title: A Love Letters phone booth is at at the Boston Public Library
author: Meredith Goldstein
bullets: The Boston Public Library has installed a Love Letters phone booth at the Boylston Street entrance as of February 12.
The 'Tell-A-Booth' allows users to leave anonymous messages about relationships for the Love Letters column.
The booth encourages sharing feelings on topics like friendships and marriage; it's already received numerous messages since opening.

title: If Boston had its own ‘Winter Olympics,’ what would the events be?
author: Annie Jonas
bullets: Boston locals imagined unique Winter Olympics events like 'Spot Saver Curling' and 'Storrow Drive Limbo' on Reddit.
Events included 'Charles River ice crossing survival' and driving challenges like 'Southie Parallel Parking'.
The lineup featured humorous trials such as 'Gloveless iced coffee speed walking' and 'Synchronized Snow Shoveling'.

title: Jaylen Brown has conversation with Dana White as he toys with idea of future career in UFC after NBA
author: Khari A. Thompson
bullets: Jaylen Brown, 29, is considering boxing or a career in UFC after retiring from the NBA.
Brown discussed his interest in fighting sports with UFC President Dana White and trained in Muay Thai.
Brown's father, Marselles, was a professional boxer, and Brown currently averages 29.3 points for the Celtics.

title: Mass. man faces slew of charges after allegedly driving drunk with kids in car
author: Samantha Genzer
bullets: Honorio Lisboa Jr., 42, of Worcester, was arrested in Southborough for DUI, child endangerment, and other charges.
Police detected alcohol on Lisboa during a traffic stop; two children were in rear-facing car seats in the vehicle.
Lisboa is held on multiple charges and an outstanding Florida warrant; he pleaded not guilty and bail was set.

title: A father in Shirley built a 20-foot snowman for his daughter
author: Autumn Sloboda
bullets: Eric Aalerud built a 20-foot snowman named 'Parker' in Shirley, Massachusetts, attracting neighborhood visitors and photos.
The snowman began as a typical size but grew over two winters, with Aalerud using a platform to complete it.
Aalerud's wife supports the project, and there are plans to make a larger snowman next winter with upgraded equipment.

title: This Braintree mom is running Boston for Mass. Eye and Ear
author: Annie Jonas
bullets: Katie Nicoloro from Braintree will run the 2026 Boston Marathon for the first time.
She is participating to inspire her children by demonstrating that challenging goals are achievable.
Nicoloro is supported by her family, including her children Jack, Evelyn, and niece Abigail at the finish line.

title: Group of juveniles kick man into moving train at Back Bay Station
author: Abby Patkin
bullets: A 27-year-old man was injured after being kicked into a moving Orange Line train at Back Bay Station.
The altercation occurred after a verbal dispute escalated into a physical attack by juveniles on Tuesday evening.
No arrests have been made, and MBTA Transit Police are investigating the incident with detectives actively involved.

title: Framingham Baking Co. to close after 109 years in business
author: Autumn Sloboda
bullets: Framingham Baking Co. in Framingham will close on March 29 after 109 years in business.
The bakery, known for its Italian-style sheet pizzas, was founded by three Italian immigrant brothers in 1917.
Owners Joan, Ernie, and Kathy expressed gratitude to customers and employees but did not specify the reason for closing.

title: AG Campbell files brief to block termination of protected status for Haitian immigrants
author: Samantha Genzer
bullets: AG Andrea Joy Campbell filed a brief to maintain Temporary Protected Status for Haitian immigrants, opposing a federal appeal.
The brief argues ending TPS for Haitians would harm families, the economy, and public health in Massachusetts.
Campbell co-led 18 attorneys general, highlighting Haitians' $3.4 billion annual U.S. economic contribution and essential community roles.

title: City councilor asks police to investigate group of bikers seen in Chinatown
author: Ross Cristantiello
bullets: City Councilor Ed Flynn requests police investigation of large biker group in Chinatown and Leather District.
Flynn's request follows constituents' concerns about motorized vehicles' safety risks and traffic violations.
Boston police observed the group near Boston Commons; no police report available as of Wednesday.
